alert.note: Alert for Kemper; Neshoba; Newton; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 9:19AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Newton, northwestern Kemper, southeastern Scott and Neshoba Counties through 945 AM CST... At 919 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stallo to near Dixon to Forest. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Philadelphia, Pearl River and Stallo around 925 AM CST. Burnside and Bethsaida around 930 AM CST. Conehatta and Forestdale around 935 AM CST. Prospect around 940 AM CST. Preston, Neshoba and Stratton around 945 AM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Tucker, Lake and Sebastopol. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees.
